arts.ttl: Peterborough sack Darren Ferguson as Blackpool defeat leaves them bottom
arts.sum: Ferguson was in fourth spell as manager at club Owner ‘devastated’ to fire club’s ‘greatest manager’ Peterborough have sacked Darren Ferguson after the 2-1 home defeat by fellow strugglers Blackpool, which left them bottom of League One. Blackpool – with Ian Evatt at the helm after he replaced Steve Bruce, who was sacked at the start of the month – took the lead when a Josh Bowler shot hit the unlucky Peter Kioso and went in after 35 minutes. Posh levelled when Matt Garbett fired home from outside the box just before half-time, but the visitors won it with five minutes to go when Scott Banks curled home. Continue reading...
